title: Why it's only right that 4 out of 5 nominees for Model of the Year are women of colour
text:
For the first time in The Fashion Awards' 18-year history, 4 out of 5 of the nominees for the highly-coveted Model of the Year award are black or mixed race women.

Adwoa Aboah (who, in 2017, became the second woman of colour to win), Winnie Harlow, Adut Akech and Adesuwa Aighewi are joined by Kaia Gerber on the list of finalists. The winner will be announced at the awards ceremony on Monday 2nd December at London's Royal Albert Hall, with thousands of guests - from celebrities to designers and editors - in attendance.

Last year Winnie Harlow, who rose to fame on TV show America’s Next Top Model, was also nominated for the award alongside Adut Akech, the South Sudanese model who was raised in...
description: For the first time in The Fashion Awards' 18-year history, 4 out of 5 of the nominees for the highly-coveted Model of the Year award are black or mixed race women.
